node.excerpt: Coupling is always with respect to a particular change The above statement by Kent Beck (see ~14:00 here) had me re-evaluating my…

frontmatter.title: Coupling (and Cohesion) is a Tradeoff
frontmatter.description: Coupling is usually described as something intrinsic: code is either coupled or not. But Kent Beck argues that it is always with respect to a particular change. What does that mean for us?

node.excerpt: If you’re trying to get more productive at writing or content creation (especially long-form), I highly recommend checking out How to take…

frontmatter.title: Zettelkasten from "How to take Smart Notes"
frontmatter.description: A review and summary of 'How to take Smart Notes' and the Zettelkasten process described within. I think of it as purposeful note-taking, used to generate ideas for writing or content creation.

node.excerpt: When I first came across the concept of Polymorphism in Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), it wasn’t obvious to me why it was important. The…

frontmatter.title: Why use Polymorphism in OOP?
frontmatter.description: Polymorphism in Object-Oriented Programming, while abstract, is still somewhat easy to understand. Why we should use it, though, is less obvious. Let's investigate polymorphism's benefits!
